item.title: Hi, I'm Brennan.
item.description: I’m a Site Reliability Engineering Intern at DraftKings and a FIRST robotics mentor. I’m currently based out of Lowell MA (greater Boston area). As a site reliability engineer, I focus on building secure, scalable, maintainable infrastructure - leveraging tools like terraform and DNSControl to achieve these goals. Previously, I worked as a full stack web developer, writing performance-oriented business-to-business SaaS apps. In my free time, I maintain a blog, as well as develop personal IoT projects around the house.

item.title: Looking to reach me?
item.description: You can always email me at my personal email: me@brennanmacaig.com (I check this daily). You could also @ me on my Twitter, or message me on my GitHub. Further, you could try reaching me on LinkedIn, although I don’t check it very often. I think you copied my content without permission I certainly hope not! If this is the case, please reach out to me immediately, and I’ll happily resolve the issue.

item.title: Howdy!
item.description: My name is Brennan, and welcome to my new blog. I’m trying to be more active in writing a blog - this will be mostly useless musings, with maybe the occasional interesting story. A lot of what I’ll be writing will be something along the lines of “today I learned” - as I am very much still a student (oh hey, thanks Blake for this fantastic idea). Recently, a friend of mine Nate started a new blog, which really inspired me to get on the blog writing train.
